item.title: Report X-2024110650
item.description:
Report X-2024110650

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-10
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the SEAR location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. While investigating the shipment two one gallon plastic containers were inside of the fiberboard box and the cap was loose on one of them. The label of the plastic container stated the contents were flammable liquid and vapor so the spill agent looked for an SDS it states the product is UN1993. There were no DG markings on the out packaging or paperwork. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the loaction.

item.title: Report X-2024110699
item.description:
Report X-2024110699

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-06
  • City: TUKWILA

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PLASTIC DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE GLOVES,GOGGLES,BOOTS,APRON,SILVER LINING WAS PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACEDINTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.ALL TUBS/PPE WAS THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTI ETT.

item.title: Report X-2024110648
item.description:
Report X-2024110648

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-20T12:31:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-03
  • City: EVERETT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 20000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Tank car GATX 109865 was reported to be leaking with visible vapor release and icing on the protective housing while in the BNSF Everett Delta yard. The car was isolated and responders were mobilized to inspect. Upon inspection, it was found that the sample line valve was cracked near the threads to the sample line nipple. A Midland kit was installed to control the release. GATX 109865 was transferred to the FURX 130095. The cracked sample valve was removed from the car and a cap installed to secure the car for movement under an OTMA to shop for repairs. Release estimates are based upon evaluation of outage at the time of the response in comparison to original outage. All released Butane dissipated to atmosphere.
